sentence.Network_en: Hay fever is an affliction which arrives at an early age.
sentence.Network_cn: 枯草热是年纪较小时会患的一种病。

sentence.Network_en: He drove by with a big load of hay.
sentence.Network_cn: 他载着一大车干草驶过。

sentence.Network_en: Rainy weather brings blessed relief to hay fever victims.
sentence.Network_cn: 雨天会给枯草热患者带来欣喜，减轻他们的痛苦。

phrase.cizu_name: make hay while the sun shines

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)make good use of an opportunity while it lasts

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hēg, hīeg, hīg, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch hooi and German Heu, also to hew
early 16th cent.: from an obsolete sense 'a kind of dance' of French haie 'hedge', figuratively 'row of people lining the route of a procession'

entry.def: Hay is grass which has been cut and dried so that it can be used to feed animals.

entry.tran: 趁太阳好晒草;抓紧有利时机;不失良机
entry.def: If you say that someone is making hay or is making hay while the sun shines, you mean that they are taking advantage of a situation that is favourable to them while they have the chance to.

example.ex: We knew that war was coming, and were determined to make hay while we could.
example.tran: 我们知道战争即将爆发，决心要趁早抓住有利时机。

means.word_mean: 1. grass mowed and cured for use as fodder

example.en: Some hay-eater was over there, looking around sort of suspicious.
example.zh: 有个白人在那儿东张西望，有点儿形迹可疑。

auth_sentence.content: Well, we feed cows clover and alfalfa hay.
auth_sentence.res_content: Well, we feed cows clover and alfalfa hay.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Well, we feed cows clover and alfalfa hay.

auth_sentence.content: A pigeon flew in through the open hay door.
auth_sentence.res_content: A pigeon flew in through the open hay door.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A pigeon flew in through the open hay door.

jushi.english: Cattle eat more hay when they have hay before them all the time.
jushi.chinese: 牲口面前一直放着干草就会吃得多些。
